title: Ticket #7365: VMGahp incorrectly accounts for active running VMs after failure
description:
Due to qcow failures (https://htcondor-wiki.cs.wisc.edu/index.cgi/tktview?tn=7364), the VMGahp turned itself off by setting "HasVm = False" but it seemed to have an incorrect understanding of how many VMs were running: 

If a condor_reconfig is insufficient, then it would seem that there's
also a mismatch between the startd VM_AvailNum attribute and what the
VM Gahp is using for its number of running VMs. In #98983, we saw this
in the VMGahpLog on e264:

11/05/19 19:04:01 (D_ALWAYS) Current number(1) of running VM reaches to maximum number(1)

And we resolved that by increasing VM_MAX_NUMBER on the host, which
seems to indicate that the VM Gahp is doing a lookup of VM_MAX_NUMBER
in the config to determine its max number and incorrectly getting the
current number of running VMs.  Additionally, it seems that the startd
is setting VM_AvailNum to:

Initial configuration of VM_MAX_NUMBER - Actual VM jobs running
